thread.title: Prep Football Roundup: Jolliff helps Ada thump Paulding
thread.title_full: Prep Football Roundup: Jolliff helps Ada thump Paulding

author: The Courier
title: Prep Football Roundup: Jolliff helps Ada thump Paulding
text:
Comment: 0 
ADA — Trent Jolliff threw a pair of touchdown passes to Jordan Bailey and ran for two more scores as Ada thumped winless Paulding 44-0 on Friday night in a Northwest Conference contest. The Panthers (0-7, 0-4 NWC) played the Polar Bears (5-2, 3-1 NWC) to a scoreless tie in the first quarter, but Jolliff completed a 13-yard touchdown pass to Bailey and found the end zone on runs of 2 yards and 1 yard as Ada built a 21-0 halftime advantage. Jolliff hit Bailey for another 13-yard touchdown pass before Aaron Everhart scored on an interception return and a 43-yard run. The Polar Bears concluded the scoring by tackling Kameron Echols in the end zone for a safety. Jolliff finished 15 of 30 passing for 198 yards, with Blake Ansley making eight catches for 81 yards. Ada’s defense limited the Panthers to 39 yards of offense. 
Paulding 0 0 0 0 — 0 Ada 0 21 14 9 — 44 Second Quarter ADA — Bailey 13 pass from Jolliff (Everhart kick) ADA — Jolliff 2 run (Everhart kick) ADA — Jolliff 1 run (Everhart kick) Third Quarter ADA — Bailey 13 pass from Jolliff (Everhart kick) ADA — Everhart interception return (Everhart kick) Fourth Quarter ADA — Everhart 43 run (Everhart kick) ADA — Safety, Echols tackled in end zone 
OTTAWA-GLANDORF 24 KENTON 14 KENTON — Connor Niese rumbled for 173 yards and two touchdowns on 24 carries as Ottawa-Glandorf beat Kenton 24-14 on Friday in a Western Buckeye League football game. Zac Unterbrink scored O-G’s other touchdown on a 1-yard run in the second quarter, as he totaled 43 yards on 11 carries. He also threw for 239 yards on 21 of 38 passing for the Titans as they improved to 6-1 overall, 5-1 in the WBL. The Titans’ defense — which was only on the field for 15:19 of 48 minutes — was led by Jay Garcia who notched two interceptions, while Logan Balbaugh registered two sacks. 
Ottawa-Glandorf 0 7 7 10 — 24 Kenton 7 7 0 0 — 14 First Quarter K — Deardorff 10 pass from Hites (Deardorff kick) Second Quarter OG — Unterbrink 1 run (Ball kick) K — Reichelderfer 15 pass from Hites (Deardorff kick) Third Quarter OG — Niese 9 run (Ball kick) Fourth Quarter OG — Niese 5 run (Ball kick) 
SWANTON 56 PATRICK HENRY 28 HAMLER — Three defensive touchdowns, two coming in a 27-point second quarter helped propel Swanton to a 56-28 win over Patrick Henry in a Northwest Ohio Athletic League football game on Friday. Swanton (7-0, 4-0 NWOAL) remained undefeated in the league with the win; the Patriots fell to 3-4, 1-3. Mitch Bonner led the charge for Patrick Henry, tossing two touchdowns and 81 yards on 11 of 21 passing, while adding a team-high 72 yards rushing on 12 carries. Tristin Novak rushed for two touchdowns and 33 yards on nine carries for the Patriots. 
Patrick Henry 8 8 12 0 — 28 Swanton 8 27 14 7 — 56 First Quarter S — McComb 1 run (Rankin run) PH — Zimmer 6 pass from Bonner (Bonner run) Second Quarter S — McComb 9 run (pass failed) S — Dziengelewski 22 fumble return (pass failed) S — Oaks 34 interception return (Kobak kick) S — Oaks 28 pass from McComb (Tempe pass from McComb) PH — Van De Bussche 9 pass from Bonner (Bonner run) Third Quarter PH — Novak 1 run (run failed) PH — Novak 7 run (pass failed) S — McComb 43 run (Kobak kick) S — Oaks 20 INT return (Kobak kick) Fourth Quarter S — Lawniczak 33 run (Kobak kick) 
SPENCERVILLE 41 BLUFFTON 7 SPENCERVILLE — Zach Goecke rushed 24 times for 295 yards and six touchdowns as state-ranked Spencerville downed Bluffton 41-7 in a Northwest Conference football game. Mitchell Ault connected with Dakota Bricker on a 58-yard first quarter touchdown for Bluffton’s lone score of the game. Ault finished 6 of 19 passing for 126 yards, while Bricker led with 85 yards on four catches and totaled another 32 yards on nine carries. Kaleb Jefferson led the Pirates with 10 total tackles, while Sam Crisp had two tackles for loss as they fell to 4-3 overall, 1-3 in the NWC. Goecke scored on runs of 2, 6, 81, 2, 4 and 60 yards. Spencerville rushed for 430 yards on 53 carries. The Bearcats, ranked fourth in the Associated Press Division VI poll, improved to 6-0, 3-0. 
Bluffton 7 0 0 0 — 7 Spencerville 6 22 13 0 — 41 First Quarter Spe — Goecke 2 run (kick failed) Blu — Bricker 58 pass from Ault (Lancaster kick) Second Quarter Spe — Goecke 8 run (Goecke run) Spe — Goecke 81 run (kick blocked) Spe — Goecke 3 run (Goecke run) Third Quarter Spe — Goecke 4 run (Blair kick) Spe — Goecke 60 run (kick failed) 
SIDNEY LEHMAN 49 HARDIN NORTHERN 13 SIDNEY — Senior Stephen Monnin accounted for 301 yards of total offense and four touchdowns Friday night as Sidney Lehman steamrolled Hardin Northern 49-13 in Northwest Central Conference play. Monnin was 13 of 19 passing for 137 yards, connecting with Brandon Barhorst on 21- and 13-yard touchdown tosses. Monnin added 164 yards rushing on 14 carries and scored on runs of eight and 13 yards. On the night, Sidney Lehman (4-3, 3-1 NWCC) piled up 506 net yards with 349 on the ground. Hardin Northern (3-4, 1-3) Wes Schlatter net 38 yards on 15 carries with a 3-yard scoring run in the second quarter. Andrew Strump went 11 yards in the fourth quarter for the team’s other TD. The Polar Bears had 91 yards rushing and 41 passing. 
Hardin Northern 0 7 0 6 — 13 Sidney Lehman 14 21 7 7 — 49 First Quarter SL — Barhorst 21 pass from Monnin (Lee kick) SL — Monnin 8 run (Lee kick) Second Quarter SL — Earhart 40 run (Lee kick) HN — Schlatter 3 run (Drumm kick) SL — Earhart 25 run (Lee kick) SL — Monnin 12 run (Lee kick) Third Quarter SL — Barhorst 13 pass from Monnin (Lee kick) Fourth Quarter SL — Sollmann 11 pass from Gilardi (Lee kick) HN — Stump 11 run (kick failed)
